Articles.Content:
![hQouWui.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/hQouWui.jpg?1)

So, I was originally going to keep doing a new release post for every tank I made, but that's gotten impossible due to the fact that I make 2 or 3 a day now. So from now on I'll post them all to this one release page, a sort of blog on a post. Some of my facebook friends in the KSP group suggested doing this so here it is.

All the tanks shown are fully stock and require no mods to operate. Photos were created using GIMP and PIXLR, image manipulation programs. These craft were built to replicate first, operate second. All turrets are designed to move and wheels to move, although performance varies from tank to tank. Part count is also high (400-700) on most tanks due to the detail required in a replica.

**The Current tanks in my collection:**

[**T-34 1940**](http://www./download/2g48anb9kxyfwv9/T-34+1940.craft)

[**T-34 1942**](http://www./download/u0oipf48dbz02a5/T-34+1942.craft)

[**T-34-85**](http://www./download/joyo8tl768ornuk/T-34-85.craft)

[**Iosif Stalin 4**](http://www./download/uvsd2s5siokoujc/IS-4+D.craft)

[**SU-85**](http://www./download/pnxnjng734dkkg2/Su-85.craft)

[**Su-100**](http://www./download/b747he5b1ehvhob/Su-100.craft)

[**M46 Patton**](http://www./download/m3m7u9xn3qa0u80/M46+Patton.craft)

[**T26E4 Super Pershing**](http://www./download/cti1zzqalordjcu/T26E4+Super+Pershing.craft)

[**M4A3 Sherman**](http://www./download/948rczmh9f1yk52/M4A3.craft)

[**M4A3 HVSS Sherman**](http://www./download/nocex6tum0asy7g/M4A3+HVSS.craft)

[**M4A2-76W HVSS Sherman**](http://www./download/4ayc1l6pcnre0ln/M4A2-76W+HVSS+Sherman.craft)

[**M4A3E2 Jumbo Sherman**](http://www./download/2f4bm7nzkz06kdj/M4A3E2+Jumbo+Sherman.craft)

[**M4A3E8 "Easy Eight" Sherman**](https://www./?5l1yb20rlk1dxok)

[**Achilles Tank Destroyer**](http://www./download/nbobdrs1c2h7gm5/M10+Achillies.craft)

[**T34 Calliope Sherman**](https://www./?v9vfdb7j21vbd07)

[**Sherman VC Firefly I**](https://www./?kuv2dt2b9btufoe)

[**Pz.KPfw. V Panther**](https://www./?8ixv2b1b2l8afuy)

[**Jadgpanther**](https://www./?xrr33deg2z7g3d8)

Those are epic!
Someone's been playing War Thunder
Where are the boosters?

Yop !

It's great to see all your tanks in a Mega-thread , that's far more easy !

You are our Tank Master now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks so much guys ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So I went back and edited all four M4 Shermans I had, because they were sluggish and really slow, found out Rove-Mates are really bad wheels to propel a tank with. I replaced them all with ruggedized wheels, the Shermans are now the fastest tanks in the group. Download has been updated, enjoy.
These are just beautiful! Loving the detail on the replicas and the extra effects added on the pictures!

> 
> Thanks so much guys ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> So I went back and edited all four M4 Shermans I had, because they were sluggish and really slow, found out Rove-Mates are really bad wheels to propel a tank with. I replaced them all with ruggedized wheels, the Shermans are now the fastest tanks in the group. Download has been updated, enjoy.

Now if you can make it so they break a lot it will be perfectly realistic!

> 
> Now if you can make it so they break a lot it will be perfectly realistic!

Never put a panther at final gear...

Well I'm actually going to make a panther next - I just finished the T34 Calliope, it's awesome stock and amazing with BD (I put 20 sidewinders on it and unguided they really are shock and awe). Will release the stock version when I get home

> 
> Well I'm actually going to make a panther next - I just finished the T34 Calliope, it's awesome stock and amazing with BD (I put 20 sidewinders on it and unguided they really are shock and awe). Will release the stock version when I get home

All aboard the weaponized hype train!

In a fun coincidence sort of way, tanks are named tanks because the word for that particular form of container was the codename of the early British Mk Is as they were transported across Europe before the Battle of Somme in World War I.

PS. Omg panther gib

> 
> next tank is halfway done...

The hull looks amazingly well done. I am not sure those wheels are the right choice for the Panther's road wheels. Anything narrower?

> 
> The hull looks amazingly well done. I am not sure those wheels are the right choice for the Panther's road wheels. Anything narrower?

Anything less than ruggedized are absolutely worthless on tanks - proved that with the M4 (top speed 6 m/s with the baloon tyres, 20+ with rugged)
